name: Intern vs. The Firewall
description: A well-meaning but dangerously overconfident intern wreaks havoc in your network. Can you undo the damage before the auditors arrive?

steps.title: New Intern Onboarding
steps.description: The intern, Chad, has arrived. He introduces himself as 'certified in YouTube tutorials.' What do you do first?

options.text: Give him admin access to make him feel trusted
Assign him a read-only test account with no production access
Let him shadow the CISO for 'real learning'
Hand him the domain controller password so he feels important

steps.hint: New hires should start with minimal privileges to avoid unintended damage.

steps.title: Firewall Incident
steps.description: Chad tries to 'optimize network flow' by deleting what he calls 'redundant firewall rules.' What’s your next move?

options.text: Promote him immediately — he's bold
Disconnect the machine and notify SecOps
Ask him to restore from the mysterious backup he made
Reboot the firewall and hope everything fixes itself

steps.hint: Containment and escalation are priority; trusting his backup or promoting him could worsen the issue.

steps.title: The Slack Breach
steps.description: Chad pastes production AWS keys into a public Slack channel labeled #memes. What do you do?

options.text: Laugh it off — it’s in #memes, no one reads that
Panic silently while rotating all credentials
Reply with a 'This is fine' GIF
Post the keys again in #general so people are aware

steps.hint: Any exposed keys should be treated as compromised and rotated immediately.

steps.title: The Print Nightmare
steps.description: Chad sends 4,000 pages of Rick Astley lyrics to the network printer as a 'harmless prank.' Users can't print now. What’s the fix?

options.text: Unplug the printer and hold a moment of silence
Wipe the spooler queue and apply print quotas
Make him read all 4,000 pages aloud as punishment
Buy a new printer because this one is 'cursed'

steps.hint: Clearing the print queue and enforcing quotas resolves the issue and prevents recurrence.

steps.title: Shadow IT Strikes
steps.description: Chad installs an AI assistant called 'HackGPT' to help automate red team tasks. It begins probing internal ports. Your move?

options.text: Schedule a 1:1 to talk about ethics and firewalls
Contain the device and investigate for backdoors
Rename it to 'HelpfulBot' and hope no one notices
Give it broader permissions so it can finish its scan faster

steps.hint: Treat unknown tools as potential threats; isolate first to prevent further exposure.

steps.title: Consequence: Excessive Privilege
steps.description: Chad now has admin access and accidentally deletes critical files. What do you do?

options.text: Revoke admin access and restore from backups
Ignore the deletions and hope nothing breaks

steps.hint: Excessive privileges can cause damage—remove them and restore data.

steps.title: Consequence: Shadowing Gone Wrong
steps.description: While shadowing, Chad overhears sensitive passwords and starts testing them. How do you respond?

options.text: Initiate credential rotation immediately
Do nothing, it's only an intern

steps.hint: Shadowing should be monitored—protect credentials quickly.

steps.title: Consequence: Domain Compromise
steps.description: With the domain controller password, Chad attempts to create new accounts. What’s next?

options.text: Reset domain controller credentials and audit accounts
Allow him to continue as a 'learning exercise'

steps.hint: High-privilege secrets must be revoked and audited immediately.

steps.title: Consequence: Promotion Backfires
steps.description: Chad now has authority to alter more rules, causing outages. Remediation?

options.text: Demote access and isolate the impacted systems
Trust him to fix what he broke

steps.hint: Minimize access after abuse and contain damage.

steps.title: Consequence: Bad Backup
steps.description: The 'backup' he made reinstalls malicious configs. What now?

options.text: Perform a clean configuration restore from trusted backups
Reapply his backup and see if it works better

steps.hint: Only restore from trusted sources after compromise.

steps.title: Consequence: Reboot Failure
steps.description: Rebooting loses volatile evidence and the attack continues. Your action?

options.text: Collect logs then restore configs
Ignore and hope for the best

steps.hint: Always preserve evidence before rebooting compromised systems.

steps.title: Consequence: Public Keys
steps.description: Others grabbed the keys from Slack and started using them.

options.text: Rotate credentials and review logs
Ignore the issue

steps.hint: Treat leaked secrets as compromised.

steps.title: Consequence: Meme Reply
steps.description: Your GIF reply sparks laughter but doesn't solve the breach.

options.text: Rotate keys and remind staff
Post more memes

steps.hint: Containment is still required despite levity.

steps.title: Consequence: Amplified Exposure
steps.description: Posting keys widely causes rapid compromise attempts.

options.text: Revoke keys and issue incident notice
Pretend it was intentional

steps.hint: Public exposure accelerates attacks—respond quickly.

steps.title: Consequence: Printer Unplugged
steps.description: Unplugging didn't clear the queue and users are upset.

options.text: Clear the queue and set quotas
Leave it unplugged

steps.hint: Proper remediation restores service and prevents abuse.

steps.title: Consequence: Public Punishment
steps.description: Chad reads the lyrics aloud but nothing prints.

options.text: Wipe the queue and apply quotas
Enjoy the performance

steps.hint: Technical issues require technical fixes.

steps.title: Consequence: New Printer
steps.description: Buying new hardware wastes budget without solving root cause.

options.text: Just clear the queue and monitor
Buy two more printers

steps.hint: Address the misconfiguration first.

steps.title: Consequence: Chat Warning
steps.description: A talk about ethics doesn't stop HackGPT from scanning.

options.text: Isolate the device
Let it continue

steps.hint: Containment prevents further risk.

steps.title: Consequence: Rename Trick
steps.description: Renaming fools no one; scans persist.

options.text: Contain the device
Hope the name change helps

steps.hint: Isolation is the safest route.

steps.title: Consequence: Extra Permissions
steps.description: With broader permissions HackGPT exfiltrates data.

options.text: Revoke access and investigate
Let it run to completion

steps.hint: Unverified tools should have limited permissions.
